oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Converting Coherence to Quantum Correlations
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ma, Jiajun
Yadin, Benjamin
Girolami, Davide
Vedral, Vlatko
Gu, Mile
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Recent results in quantum information theory characterize quantum coherence in the context of resource theories. Here we study the relation between quantum coherence and quantum discord, a kind of quantum correlation which appears even in non-entangled states. We prove that the creation of quantum discord with multipartite incoherent operations is bounded by the amount of quantum coherence consumed in its subsystems during the process. We show how the interplay between quantum coherence consumption and creation of quantum discord works in the preparation of multipartite quantum correlated states and in the model of deterministic quantum computation with one qubit.
